state.userPrompt: Build a workflow that monitors changes in a Google Sheets document, validates the data using custom logic, transforms it into different formats (JSON, XML), and simultaneously pushes updates to 3 different APIs (CRM, inventory system, and email marketing platform) with proper error handling for each endpoint.

discovered.purpose: Resilient API call with automatic retry on failure
Transform data structure using JavaScript
Examples of modern error handling using onError property
Monitor changes in Google Sheets document and start workflow when events occur
Convert data from and to XML format for transformation requirements
Split data into batches for parallel execution to multiple APIs
Merge results from multiple API endpoints after parallel execution

workflow.name: Google Sheets Multi-API Data Sync Workflow

buildPhases.description: Monitors Google Sheets document for any changes (row additions or updates) and triggers the workflow when changes are detected.
Validates incoming Google Sheets data using custom logic, transforms it into multiple formats (JSON structures for different APIs), and converts to XML format for compatibility requirements.
Splits the validated and transformed data into batches to enable parallel processing across multiple API endpoints.

Simultaneously pushes the transformed data to three different external APIs (CRM system, inventory management, and email marketing platform) with comprehensive error handling and retry logic for each endpoint.
Merges the results from all three API calls to provide a consolidated view of the synchronization status across all systems.

buildPhases.description: Monitors Google Sheets document for any changes (row additions or updates) and triggers the workflow when changes are detected.
Validates incoming Google Sheets data using custom logic, transforms it into multiple formats (JSON structures for different APIs), and converts to XML format for compatibility requirements.
Splits the validated and transformed data into batches to enable parallel processing across multiple API endpoints.

Simultaneously pushes the transformed data to three different external APIs (CRM system, inventory management, and email marketing platform) with comprehensive error handling and retry logic for each endpoint.
Merges the results from all three API calls to provide a consolidated view of the synchronization status across all systems.

node.purpose: Resilient API call with automatic retry on failure
Transform data structure using JavaScript
Examples of modern error handling using onError property
Monitor changes in Google Sheets document and start workflow when events occur
Convert data from and to XML format for transformation requirements
Split data into batches for parallel execution to multiple APIs
Merge results from multiple API endpoints after parallel execution
